thread.title: Mascot can't believe he met Manchester United Jose Mourinho before Europa League clash
thread.title_full: Mascot can't believe he met Manchester United Jose Mourinho before Europa League clash

author: Alex Smith
title: Mascot can't believe he met Manchester United Jose Mourinho before Europa League clash
text:
Sport Mascot can't believe he met Manchester United Jose Mourinho before Europa League clash United drew 1-1 in Russia - but the Portuguese manager was able to put on a smile for at least a few seconds Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Mascot can't believe he met Jose Mourinho Share this video Get Chelsea FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
They say never meet your idols - but one mascot in Russia did and if was DEFINITELY worth it. 
A kid was waiting to lead out Manchester United and FC Rostov players for their Europa League clash before Jose Mourinho jumped out to make an appearance. 
And as you can see by the video clip, the young boy was ecstatic to go face-to-face with the Portuguese mega-manager in the Olimp-2 Stadium. 
As Mourinho walks down the line, he spots the exciting face before embracing a gently kissing his bobble hat. Mourinho embraces the mascot (Photo: Olimp-2/Instagram) The youngster is star-struck (Photo: Olimp-2/Instagram) Read More Lovely gesture from Russian supermodel who offers Manchester United fans blankets 
The mascot sinks his head into his hands in disbelief as Mourinho wanders towards his dugout. 
The fan looked completely star-struck by the United boss and you can just imagine him going into school on Friday bragging to his jealous mates. 
It was a rare smile from Mourinho in Russia - after enduring a 1-1 draw and surviving a poor pitch. The tunnel meeting was a rare happy point of the trip to Russia (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Mourinho muses the second leg at Old Trafford next week (Photo: Man Utd via Getty Images) Mkhitaryan scores for United (Photo: REUTERS) 
Henrikh Mkhitaryan had his opener cancelled out by Aleksandr Bukharov to set up an intriguing second leg at Old Trafford next week. 
"It was a very good performance in relation to the conditions," the former Chelsea boss said. "It was impossible to play better, impossible to play a passing game. 
"To see my players coping with it and the humility to fight for every ball is a good feeling for me. I said before the game that I didnâ€™t want to go more and more into this. It is done. There are no injuries." Like us on Facebook
